Comments_List:
kinetics and reactors.
also some transport.
I have learned a lot of things and chemical kinetics and reactor design from this course.
kinetics knowledge in chemical engineering. MOre focus on understanding not memorizing.
Chemical reaction kinetics, ideal reactor, heterogeneous catalyst, enzyme, external and internal limit of solid-gas reaction.
Kinetics in chemical reactions, ideal reactors, catalytic reactions. For a specific chemical reaction, there are many factors which can have profound influences like temperature, catalyst.
I learn a lot about the chemical reactor and lots of knowledge about catalyst, which can facilitate my research.
Knowledge about the theories of kinetics which allowed for analysis of reaction processes. some measuring techniques and information on how to evaluate and read research papers

I learned the basic concepts regarding kinetics and modelling of reactors such as CSTR and plug flow. Also, the course was very helpful while giving the students more contact and familiarity with the literature.
the handout is sometimes not well organized.

Professor Lisa Pfefferle is a very good and responsible teacher. The lecture notes describe every point in detail. If Professor Lisa Pfefferle could recommend some reference books to us, that would be great.

This course needs clearer structure. A syllabus with the order of topics and grade distribution would be helpful so that we know what assignments to expect. Also, getting grades back on homework assignments would help us know how we are doing in the class.

Advantages: introduce more general stuff, cover a lot of topics. 
Disadvantages: some topics don't have details

Strength: The note covered almost all the information. A lot of topics about reactions is included.

Weakness: Demonstration of some process is too fast and simple.
The course included many aspects about chemical engineering. But it could be better if some details were to be addressed.

weakness:
it appeared disconnected and there was no continuous flow of ideas.

strength:
the way of evaluation was good and allowed for overall testing of the subject matter

Strengths: all the important concepts were exposed and the big picture of chemical reactions was well defined.

Weakness: not many problem sets.
Yes
For students in chemical engineering and chemistry, I will highly recommend this course to them.
It was generally an easy class, and it's required.
I would only if I have at the beginning of the course a clear idea of what will be the organization of the subject matter
I would recommend this course to another student because it gives all the tools needed to learn the subject and the instructor has a very strong background and knowledge of the content of the course.
